clues.text: Jot down this letter, 9th in the Greek alphabet
They're the overhanging edges of a roof
A solemn promise or a cuss word
A trapeze artist
Soft feathers from the breast of a certain duck
"Let Bartlet Be Bartlet" was an episode of this D.C.-set TV series
Julia Louis-Dreyfus is, God help us, a heartbeat away from the most powerful office in the world on this HBO comedy
Candice Bergen spent a decade playing this title Washington, D.C. reporter
On this ABC soap the president (Tony Goldwyn) is having an affair & has murdered a Supreme Court justice; what a...
On "The Americans" Matthew Rhys & Keri Russell live in the D.C. suburbs while working as spies for this Russian agency
More than 100 million pounds of lobster were harvested there in 2011
250 Statues of Liberty could fit inside this state's Mall of America
Its motto is Latin for "if you seek a pleasant peninsula, look about you"
In area it's the largest of the 8 "M" states
It's named for a British queen
Like "Mr. Ripley" in the title of a Patricia Highsmith novel
Designating a quantity greater than zero
Rod Laver helped his bank account when he turned this status in 1963
Reliable; it's the first quality mentioned in the Boy Scout Law
From the Latin for "suffering", it means capable of powerful emotion about something
Shakespeare used this 3-word phrase in "The Tempest" 320 years before Aldous Huxley used it as a title
In an 1806 letter, this president said we must "convince the world that we are just friends and brave enemies"
In this story of a Trojan hero, Virgil wrote that "fortune favors the brave"
During this intra-Greek war, Pericles said, "the secret of happiness is freedom & the secret of freedom a brave heart"
In "The Ballad of Reading Gaol", he wrote that "each man kills the thing he loves"; "the brave man with a sword"
It can be a religious group or the value of a piece of paper money
From the Greek for "fire craft", it's the art of making fireworks
For the 2 pieces of equipment used, it's another name for windsurfing
Type of cloud that's also called a thunderhead
It's the French name for a movie theater that specializes in classic or avant-garde films
The U.S. Mint Police
The Bureau of Diplomatic Security
The U.S. Marshals Service
The Bureau of Indian Affairs Division of Law Enforcement
The U.S. Forest Service Law Enforcement & Investigations unit
This vice president from Tenn. joked he was so dull, his code name was simply his name, but officially, he was "Sundance"
The Secret Service also protects foreign dignitaries; "Halo" was this late man's code name
Fittingly, Fraction is the Secret Service code name for this cabinet post
This late Massachusetts senator was "Sunburn"; his mom, "Coppertone"
Sarah Palin was assigned this code name, the native name of the tallest mountain in her state
Julianna Margulies got out of TV nursing & into TV law as Alicia Florrick on this drama
Fighter pilot to navy lawyer was the career path for Harmon Rabb on this drama, for 10 years on 2 different networks
Patty Hewes, played by her, went through 5 seasons of "Damages", including those done to her ethics
Richard Fish, on this Calista Flockhart show: "Objection, your honor! This is boring"
This man played both law (a sage small-town sheriff) & order (wily lawyer Ben Matlock)
A group of gorillas living together is called this, just like in Boy Scouts
Koko.org is a conservation website named for a famous gorilla who communicates with humans using this language
Gorillas are mammals that belong to this scientific order that includes lemurs & marmosets
Captured in 1966, Snowflake was the only gorilla ever discovered of this type; his skin was unable to produce pigment
Actually done with cupped hands, this often-imitated male gorilla action is part of a 9-step series that begins with hooting
On opening day in 1937, the San Francisco Chronicle referred to it as a "35 million dollar steel harp"
On May 1, 1931 the lights were turned on in this NYC skyscraper with the press of a button in the White House
This massive project was the first in North America to contain more masonry than the Great Pyramid at Giza
A highway completed in 1938 allowed one to drive from Miami to this southernmost city in the continental U.S.
Between 1937 & 1939 NYC's North Beach Airport was enlarged, becoming what's now this airport

rounds.comments: (Alex: Each correct response will end will those three letters.)

To play for time
To exclude or ostracize someone

rounds.text: He took the Oath of Office twice 14 months apart
